Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Introducing Claude Opus 4.5
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | November 24, 2025
Claude Opus 4.5 revolutionizes coding and enterprise workflows by optimizing decision-making processes through its unique ability to pause and reflect. Demonstrating superior performance, it achieved record-breaking scores on complex engineering tasks, surpassing human capabilities and setting a new benchmark in the field.
B.)
The 2045 Superintelligence Timeline: Epoch AI‚Äôs Data-Driven Forecast
| a16z | YouTube.com | November 24, 2025
Epoch AI researchers provide an in-depth analysis of emerging AI dynamics, forecasting significant advancements in energy infrastructure and labor market shifts. Insights include the potential for solving major mathematical problems and the future implications for GDP growth, alongside a critical look at the evolving landscape of superintelligence.
C.)
OpenAI Claims To Have First AI Hardware Prototype Designed By Jony Ive And Sam Altman For ChatGPT
| TheVerge.com | November 24, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs first piece of hardware could arrive in ‚Äúless than‚Äù two years, according to Ive.
D.)
AI News: Insane Week ‚Äì Gemini 3 Was Just The Start
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | November 22, 2025
A whirlwind week in artificial intelligence saw significant developments, including the launch of Google‚Äôs Gemini 3 and Microsoft‚Äôs introduction of over 70 new AI features at Ignite. Notable releases from xAI, Meta, and OpenAI further highlighted the accelerating race in AI technology and capabilities, sparking discussions on new tools, innovations, and some surprising moments in the field.
E.)
The AI of 2026 Will Be Different
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 21, 2025
Experts predict a rapid evolution in artificial intelligence by 2026, characterized by significant advancements in autonomy, multimodality, and real-time learning. Exploring the implications for industries and individuals alike, this analysis delves into a future where AI systems can strategize and collaborate, fundamentally changing workflows and daily life.

This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
December 1, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
How to Use Notion AI to Save HOURS Every Week
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Igor Pogany explores the transformative features of Notion 3.0 and Notion AI, highlighting innovations that can significantly enhance productivity. This comprehensive guide caters to both newcomers and seasoned users eager to optimize their Notion experience as we look towards 2026.
6.)
Notepad: Get Back What They Took From You!
| Dave‚Äôs Garage | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Dave demonstrates how to recreate the classic Notepad experience using GPT Codex Max 5.1 in Extra High mode, restoring beloved features that users have missed. This presentation also offers a free sample of his book on the Spectrum and highlights exciting Black Friday deals on Slate devices.
7.)
Making AI Security Accessible with Vasu Jakkal (Microsoft CVP Security)
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Grant Harvey interviews Vasu Jakkal, Corporate Vice President at Microsoft Security, to uncover how AI can both enhance security and safeguard AI systems. The discussion covers Microsoft‚Äôs initiatives to democratize AI security tools for organizations of all sizes and highlights the role of AI in addressing the cybersecurity skills gap.
8.)
The $700 Billion AI Productivity Problem No One‚Äôs Talking About
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Russ Fradin shares insights on the crucial need for measurement infrastructure in AI, drawing parallels to the ad tech sector. In conversation with a16z‚Äôs Alex Rampell, they uncover the hidden AI use among employees and discuss the implications for businesses relying on AI tools.
9.)
The ‚ÄúNano Banana‚Äù of AI Video Is Here!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | December 1, 2025
Kling 01 introduces a revolutionary shift in AI video generation, merging text, images, and advanced understanding into a cohesive system. With features such as the Elements Library for character consistency and the ability to manipulate footage through natural language commands, this is poised to reshape the landscape of AI filmmaking.
10.)
AI Music Is Getting Out Of Control Atm
| TheNeuronDaily.com | December 1, 2025
Recent developments in AI music include a generated song achieving chart-topping status while showcasing the complexities and ethical dilemmas involved, particularly surrounding copyright and artist representation. In an intriguing turn, major music labels are shifting their strategies to work with AI-generated content rather than attempting to suppress it.
11.)
Google Expands Gemini 3 Pro And Nano Banana Pro Rollout To More Countries In Search
| Blog.google | December 1, 2025
Starting today, Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers can begin using Gemini 3 Pro by tapping ‚ÄúThinking with 3 Pro‚Äù in the model drop-down in AI Mode. Thanks to Gemini 3‚Äôs state-of-the-art reasoning capabilities, AI Mode can grasp the nuance of your most complex queries. And Gemini 3‚Äôs unparalleled multimodal understanding and powerful agentic coding capabilities are unlocking new generative user interfaces, so you can get dynamic visual layouts, interactive tools and custom simulations, all generated on the fly, specifically for your query.
12.)
Openagi Unveils Lux AI Agent Claiming 83.6% Benchmark, Outperforming OpenAI At Lower Cost
| Venturebeat.com | December 1, 2025
A stealth artificial intelligence startup founded by an MIT researcher emerged this morning with an ambitious claim: its new AI model can control computers better than systems built by OpenAI and Anthropic, at a fraction of the cost.
13.)
Nvidia Unveils New Open AI Tools And Models For Speech, Safety, And Autonomous Driving At Neurips
| Blogs.nvidia.com | December 1, 2025
Physical AI
NVIDIA releases new AI tools for speech, safety and autonomous driving, including NVIDIA DRIVE Alpamayo-R1, the world‚Äôs first open industry-scale reasoning vision language action model for mobility, and a new independent benchmark recognizes the openness and transparency of NVIDIA Nemotron models and datasets.
14.)
Nvidia And Synopsys Form Strategic Partnership To Transform Engineering And Design Industries
| NvidiaNews.nvidia.com | December 1, 2025
NVIDIA and Synopsys, Inc. today announced an expanded, strategic partnership to revolutionize design and engineering across industries.
15.)
OpenAI Partners With NORAD To Add ChatGPT-Powered Holiday Tools To ‚ÄòNorad Tracks Santa‚Äô Experience
| OpenAI.com | December 1, 2025
Every December, millions of families worldwide follow along as the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) tracks Santa‚Äôs journey across the globe. It is a tradition full of wonder, and this year we are excited to add a few new touches to help parents make the season feel even more magical.
16.)
OpenAI Acquires Stake In Thrive Holdings To Drive Enterprise AI In Accounting And It Services
| OpenAI.com | December 1, 2025
OpenAI and Thrive Holdings are partnering to accelerate enterprise AI adoption. Thrive Holdings invests in, acquires, and builds businesses that benefit from long-term, technology-driven transformation.
17.)
Accenture Partners With OpenAI, Deploys 40,000 ChatGPT Enterprise Licenses To Boost AI Capabilities
| OpenAI.com | December 1, 2025
Accenture and OpenAI are collaborating to help enterprises bring agentic AI capabilities into the core of their business and unlock new levels of growth. As part of the agreement, Accenture will equip tens of thousands of its professionals with ChatGPT Enterprise so the firm can leverage it in consulting, operations and delivery work and help OpenAI scale its capabilities to enterprises. By embedding OpenAI technology and practices in Accenture‚Äôs consulting, operations and delivery work, Accenture will apply its learnings and experiences to helping clients scale their own adoption.
18.)
Runway Unveils Gen-4.5 Model With Enhanced Video Generation, Motion Quality, And Visual Fidelity
| RunwayML.com | December 1, 2025
Runway Gen-4.5 is the world‚Äôs top-rated video model, offering unprecedented visual fidelity and creative control. It produces cinematic and highly realistic outputs while providing limitless creative freedom and precise control over every aspect of generation.
19.)
Deepseek Launches V3.2 & Speciale Models Enhancing Agent Reasoning Capabilities
| X.com | December 1, 2025
DeepSeek-V3.2: Official successor to V3.2-Exp. Now live on App, Web & API. DeepSeek-V3.2-Speciale: Pushing the boundaries of reasoning capabilities. API-only for now.
November 30, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
20.)
Almost Timely News: Better Vocabulary for Better AI Results
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | November 30, 2025
Christopher Penn highlights the significance of enhancing vocabulary to optimize outcomes with artificial intelligence. By leveraging industry-specific jargon, viewers will learn how to refine prompts, facilitating AI‚Äôs ability to deliver more precise and contextually relevant results.
21.)
Top 15 New AI Advancements (This Year)
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 30, 2025
The latest developments in artificial intelligence are showcased, highlighting transformative technologies and innovative models that are impacting various sectors such as medicine, climate science, and cybersecurity. Key advancements illustrate how AI is accelerating scientific discovery and enhancing everyday life, revealing a pivotal year for technological evolution.
22.)
MIT: 11.7% Of US Jobs Could Vanish Today
| TheNeuronDaily.com | November 30, 2025
MIT‚Äôs Project Iceberg reveals that AI could replace 11.7% of the American workforce immediately, affecting $1.2 trillion in wages. The study highlights the disparity between actual AI deployment and potential job automation, emphasizing vulnerabilities in cognitive roles across various sectors.
November 29, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
23.)
ChatGPT Android Beta Reveals Upcoming Ads Feature Initiative
| X.com | November 29, 2025
ChatGPT Android app 1.2025.329 beta includes new references to an ‚Äúads feature‚Äù with ‚Äúbazaar content‚Äù, ‚Äúsearch ad‚Äù and ‚Äúsearch ads carousel‚Äù.
November 28, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
24.)
Siri Isn‚Äôt That Bad
| Marques Brownlee | YouTube.com | November 28, 2025
Despite the common criticisms of Siri, a closer examination reveals its capabilities and improvements over time. Engaging insights and comparisons shed light on the virtual assistant‚Äôs performance and user experience, inviting viewers to reconsider its reputation.
25.)
AI News: Did These Models Just Beat Google?
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | November 28, 2025
Claude Opus 4.5 and FLUX.2 lead an impressive week of AI advancements, alongside significant updates from ChatGPT and Meta‚Äôs WorldGen. With multiple groundbreaking releases, the tech landscape hints at fierce competition as innovators continue to redefine AI capabilities.
26.)
ChatGPT‚Äôs New Voice Mode, Group Chats, Shopping Research & More!
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | November 28, 2025
Igor reviews the latest features introduced in ChatGPT, including an innovative Voice Mode, group chat functionalities, and advanced shopping research capabilities. Additionally, he covers significant developments in the AI field, such as Meta SAM 3, Flux.2, and Codex Max, providing viewers with a comprehensive overview of the week‚Äôs highlights.
27.)
How OpenAI Builds for 800 Million Weekly Users: Model Specialization and Fine-Tuning
| a16z | YouTube.com | November 28, 2025
Martin Casado and Sherwin Wu explore OpenAI‚Äôs transition from a singular general-purpose model to a dynamic suite of specialized systems, addressing fine-tuning and context design. They discuss the significance of developer trust in model families, the evolution of pricing strategies, and the innovations brought by recent acquisitions to OpenAI‚Äôs offerings.
28.)
Microsoft Exec Talks OpenAI, AI Bubble, Data Centers, AI Safety and More
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | November 28, 2025
Insights from a Microsoft executive illuminate crucial developments concerning OpenAI, the emerging AI landscape, and the operational aspects of data centers. Key topics include AI efficiency, the impact of AI on engineering positions, and pressing concerns around AI safety and sustainability.
29.)
$14K In AI Tools For $200
| TheNeuronDaily.com | November 28, 2025
This article highlights exclusive Black Friday deals on AI tools, featuring a package deal that offers over 17 premium tools valued at more than $14,000 for just $200 annually. It emphasizes offers from trusted partners and various AI tools that enhance productivity and growth.
30.)
Google And OpenAI Throttle Sora And Nano Banana Pro Features Due To High Demand And Usage Limits
| TheVerge.com | November 28, 2025
If you were wanting some AI-generated fun this holiday weekend, you‚Äôll need to be efficient. Google and OpenAI have cut generation request limits for Nano Banana Pro and Sora, citing overwhelming demand.
31.)
Epic CEO Tim Sweeney Urges Steam To Remove Made With AI Tags From Game Listings
| TheVerge.com | November 28, 2025
Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney thinks Steam and other game stores should drop ‚ÄúMade with AI‚Äù tags, arguing that they‚Äôll soon be irrelevant as generative AI becomes ubiquitous in production.
November 27, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
32.)
N8N 8 Hour Masterclass: Build & Sell AI Agents (Automate Anything)
| Jono Catliff | YouTube.com | November 27, 2025
Join Jono in an intensive 8-hour masterclass designed to empower you with the skills to build and monetize AI agents using n8n. Learn through ten practical workflows that showcase the potential of automation in various business applications.
33.)
New Claude Opus 4.5 Full Breakdown & Real World Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | November 27, 2025
Igor Pogany explores Anthropic‚Äôs latest release, the Claude Opus 4.5, providing a detailed analysis of its features and capabilities. Real-world use cases from various industries illustrate the practical applications and transformative potential of this advanced AI model.
34.)
Happy Thanksgiving From The Neuron!
| TheNeuronDaily.com | November 27, 2025
In celebration of Thanksgiving, The Neuron provides a light-hearted recap of recent AI news, including job cuts at HP and the release of significant AI models. The piece encourages readers to either relax or tune into their podcast while awaiting holiday festivities.
November 26, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
35.)
10 New Mind-Blowing Things You Can Do With GPT-5.1
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 26, 2025
Discover the revolutionary capabilities of GPT-5.1, which include enhanced reasoning, rapid responses, and remarkable multimodal understanding. Real use-case demonstrations reveal how this advanced AI model is transforming productivity and creativity across various fields.
36.)
Claude Agent Skills Explained
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | November 26, 2025
Exploring the functionality of Agent Skills, this segment breaks down how Claude autonomously leverages specialized expertise through organized folders. The differences between Agent Skills and other systems are clarified, providing a comprehensive understanding for developers.
37.)
Figure Robotics Fired Their Head of Safety (Lawsuit)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | November 26, 2025
Figure Robotics faces controversy with the abrupt firing of their Head of Safety amid ongoing legal disputes. The decision has ignited discussions around workplace safety protocols and organizational transparency in the rapidly evolving robotics sector.
38.)
The ‚ÄúAndroid Moment‚Äù For AI: Why Modular Raised $250M To Break GPU Lock-In
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | November 26, 2025
Tim Davis, Co-Founder and President of Modular, provides insights into the pervasive hardware lock-in affecting AI developers. He discusses Modular‚Äôs ambitious goal of creating a versatile compute layer that enables code to be run on any GPU, highlighting the company‚Äôs recent $250 million funding round and its implications for the AI infrastructure landscape.
39.)
Top 13 New Discoveries Made By AI (Part 4)
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 26, 2025
Exploring the astonishing capabilities of artificial intelligence, groundbreaking discoveries across various fields, including medicine, technology, and astrophysics, are highlighted. Significant advancements made by AI are reprogramming our understanding of the universe and revolutionizing scientific research.
40.)
WTF Is The US‚Äô ‚ÄúGenesis Mission‚Äù? America‚Äôs AI ‚ÄúManhattan Project‚Äú To Double Scientific Productivity, Explained
| TheNeuronDaily.com | November 26, 2025
The Genesis Mission is a new federal AI initiative aimed at enhancing US scientific productivity by making use of the nation‚Äôs vast scientific datasets and computing resources. It seeks to facilitate advancements in various fields including fusion energy, drug discovery, and quantum computing by optimizing research methodologies and resources.
41.)
OpenAI Reports Mixpanel Security Incident; Limited API Analytics Data Affected, No Credentials Exposed
| OpenAI.com | November 26, 2025
Transparency is important to us, so we want to inform you about a recent security incident at Mixpanel, a data analytics provider OpenAI used for web analytics on the frontend interface for our API product (platform.openai.com).
42.)
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Marks 3 Years, Transforming Work And Daily Life Worldwide
| RestOfWorld.org | November 26, 2025
Since its November 2022 launch, ChatGPT has been a global phenomenon. Here‚Äôs a look at its impact on work, life, and more across the world.
43.)
Perplexity Introduces AI Assistants With Memory For Enhanced Personalization Across Conversations
| Perplexity.ai | November 26, 2025
The simple act of remembering is the crux of how we navigate the world: it shapes our experiences, informs our decisions, and helps us anticipate what comes next. For AI agents like Comet Assistant, that continuity leads to a more powerful, personalized experience.
44.)
Luma AI Unveils Terminal Velocity Matching For 25X Faster Training Over Standard Diffusion Models
| Lumalabs.ai | November 26, 2025
Here‚Äôs a fun challenge: We have a carousel of images, organized into columns. In each column, one image was generated by 4-step TVM and the other by 50√ó2-step diffusion. Can you tell which is which?
45.)
LTXStudio Launches ‚ÄòRetake‚Äô For Post-Render Video Direction And Editing
| X.com | November 26, 2025
Introducing: Retake. For the first time ever, direct your shot after it‚Äôs rendered. Rephrase dialogue, reshape emotion and reframe moments, without redoing the full video.
November 25, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
46.)
11 Free AI Tools That Will Replace Your Paid Apps
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | November 25, 2025
Explore a curated selection of the best new AI tools that are entirely free, ranging from AI-powered design applications to innovative voice generators. This comprehensive overview provides insights into each tool and its unique features, paving the way for more efficient and budget-friendly solutions.
47.)
Flux.2 Has Landed! Is It the Open Source King?
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | November 25, 2025
Black Forest Labs returns with the launch of FLUX 2, testing its features against realistic textures and consistency. The review also highlights the impressive Hunyuan Video 1.5 and introduces a new contender from Bytedance in the competitive open-source video landscape.
48.)
Gemini 3 Shook OpenAI To Its Core
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | November 25, 2025
Delve into the groundbreaking implications of Gemini 3 as it challenges the foundational principles of OpenAI. This revolutionary advancement in AI technology raises critical discussions about the future of artificial intelligence and the ethics surrounding its evolution.
49.)
Gemini 3, Nano Banana, and The Week That Changed AI
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | November 25, 2025
In an engaging discussion, Tulsee Doshi, Google‚Äôs Head of Product for Gemini, shares insights on the innovative features of Gemini 3 and the Nano Banana Pro model. Hands-on demos highlight advances in multimodal reasoning and image generation, illustrating how these tools enhance creativity and productivity while making AI more accessible to a broader audience.
50.)
Ilya Sutskever ‚Äî We‚Äôre Moving From The Age Of Scaling To The Age Of Research
| Dwarkesh Patel | YouTube.com | November 25, 2025
Ilya Sutskever articulates the transition from scaling AI models to a focus on in-depth research, addressing challenges with pre-training and strategies to enhance the generalization of AI. Critical discussions on ensuring the successful development of artificial general intelligence provide valuable insights for the future of AI technology.
51.)
The Job Market Has Changed
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | November 25, 2025
Insights into the evolving job market reveal critical trends affecting employment and the skills businesses prioritize. As AI continues to shape industries, understanding these dynamics will be essential for career advancement in 2026.
52.)
Anthropic Launches Claude Opus 4.5
| TheNeuronDaily.com | November 25, 2025
Anthropic has released Claude Opus 4.5, the new top-performing AI model for coding and computer tasks, achieving a benchmark score of 80.9% on SWE-bench Verified. With significant improvements in efficiency and reduced pricing, Opus 4.5 is positioned to enhance the development of AI applications significantly and features resistance to prompt injection attacks.
53.)
Anthropic Releases Research Estimating Productivity Gains From AI Adoption
| Anthropic.com | November 25, 2025
What do real conversations with Claude tell us about the effects of AI on labor productivity? Using our privacy-preserving analysis method, we sample one hundred thousand real conversations from Claude.ai, estimate how long the tasks in these conversations would take with and without AI assistance, and study the productivity implications across the broader economy. Based on Claude‚Äôs estimates, these tasks would take on average about 90 minutes to complete without AI assistance, and Claude speeds up individual tasks by about 80%.
54.)
OpenAI Expands Data Residency Options Globally For ChatGPT Enterprise, EDU, And API Customers
| OpenAI.com | November 25, 2025
Organizations and developers around the world are using ChatGPT to empower their workforces and build new products. With over 1 million business customers around the world directly using OpenAI, we have expanded where we offer data residency, allowing business customers to store data in certain regions, helping organizations meet local regulatory and data protection requirements. Today, eligible customers using ChatGPT Enterprise, ChatGPT Edu, or our API Platform in many global markets can choose local data residency when using OpenAI products in their businesses and building new solutions with AI.
55.)
OpenAI Outlines New Approach To Mental Health-Related Litigation And Safety Measures In ChatGPT
| OpenAI.com | November 25, 2025
Cases involving mental health are tragic and complex, and they involve real people. We recognize that legal processes can feel removed from the people at the center of them, so we want to be clear about how we approach these situations.
56.)
Google Launches Agentic Calling In US To Let Users Ask Google To Call Local Businesses For Information
| Blog.google | November 25, 2025
We recently released a new agentic calling feature in the U.S. where you can ask Google to call local businesses for you to gather information about what‚Äôs available near you, if there are any discounts and more. Here‚Äôs how to use it.
57.)
Suno Partners With Warner Music Group To Develop Advanced AI Music Tools And Artist Engagement Features
| Suno.com | November 25, 2025
Our partnership with WMG unlocks a bigger, richer Suno experience for you. We‚Äôll be rolling out new, more robust features for creation, opportunities to collaborate and interact with some of the most talented musicians in the world, all while continuing to build the biggest music ecosystem possible.
58.)
Qualcomm Unveils Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 Chip Bringing Advanced AI To Mid-Tier Android Phones
| Cnet.com | November 25, 2025
The Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 offers top performance for Android phones just below the absolute top-tier.
59.)
Character.AI Launches Stories, A New Interactive Feature For Users To Create And Share Character Adventures
| Blog.character.ai | November 25, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre excited to launch Stories, a brand-new format where users can create and share adventures starring their favorite Characters. Stories offer a fun and visual way to play and explore through interactive fiction.
60.)
OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Voice Integration On Mobile And Web
| X.com | November 25, 2025
You can now use ChatGPT Voice right inside chat, no separate mode needed.
61.)
Google Deepmind Releases The Thinking Game Documentary For Free Streaming On YouTube
| Blog.google | November 25, 2025
In celebration of the fifth anniversary of AlphaFold, we‚Äôre bringing ‚ÄúThe Thinking Game‚Äù to the Google DeepMind YouTube channel for free starting November 25.
62.)
Perplexity Launches Shopping Feature Updates For Enhanced User Experience
| Perplexity.ai | November 25, 2025
The joy of shopping is discovering something you love. It‚Äôs the perfect winter jacket that matches your style and your San Francisco ferry commute. It‚Äôs the right gift for a young chef with a tiny kitchen. Discovery requires an experience that understands you.
63.)
Bfl.AI Launches Flux.2, Its Most Advanced Visual Intelligence Model To Date
| Bfl.ai | November 25, 2025
FLUX.2 is designed for real-world creative workflows, not just demos or party tricks. It generates high-quality images while maintaining character and style consistency across multiple reference images, following structured prompts, reading and writing complex text, adhering to brand guidelines, and reliably handling lighting, layouts, and logos. FLUX.2 can edit images at up to 4 megapixels while preserving detail and coherence.
November 24, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
64.)
OpenAI May Rename Sora App‚Äôs Cameo Feature After Cameo Enforces Trademark On The Word ‚ÄòCameo‚Äô
| TechCrunch.com | November 24, 2025
OpenAI learned the hard way that Cameo trademarked the word ‚Äòcameo‚Äô. OpenAI‚Äôs social app Sora launched with a controversial feature called Cameo, allowing users to deepfake themselves or others (with permission). The feature had a tenuous rollout, Martin Luther King Jr.‚Äôs estate had to get involved, to give you an idea of what went on, but now it faces a new challenge. Apparently, Cameo, the app where you buy custom video messages from celebrities, can claim the trademark of the word ‚Äúcameo.‚Äù
65.)
OpenAI CEO Warns Staff Of Economic Headwinds As Google Advances In AI Development
| TheInformation.com | November 24, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman recently dropped a startling memo to his staff, admitting that the company is bracing for a tough competitive spell, or as he put it, ‚Äúrough vibes.‚Äù The reason? Google‚Äôs major comeback in the AI race, fueled by its deep pockets and the widespread rollout of its newest model, Gemini 3.
66.)
Anthropic Develops New Defenses To Reduce Prompt Injection Risks In Browser-Based AI Systems
| Anthropic.com | November 24, 2025
Claude Opus 4.5 sets a new standard in robustness to prompt injections, adversarial instructions hidden within the content that AI models process. Our new model is a major improvement over previous ones in both its core performance and in the safeguards surrounding its use. But prompt injection is far from a solved problem, particularly as models take more real-world actions. We expect to continue our progress, aiming for a future where AI models (or ‚Äúagents‚Äù) can handle high-value tasks without significant prompt injection risk.
67.)
Anthropic Launches Claude Opus 4.5, Its Latest Advancement In Reliable And Interpretable AI Systems
| Anthropic.com | November 24, 2025
Our newest model, Claude Opus 4.5, is available today. It‚Äôs intelligent, efficient, and the best model in the world for coding, agents, and computer use. It‚Äôs also meaningfully better at everyday tasks like deep research and working with slides and spreadsheets. Opus 4.5 is a step forward in what AI systems can do, and a preview of larger changes to how work gets done.

White House Launches Genesis Mission To Unite US Supercomputers And Quantum Tech For Scientific Advances
| WhiteHouse.gov | November 24, 2025
This order launches the ‚ÄúGenesis Mission‚Äù as a dedicated, coordinated national effort to unleash a new age of AI-accelerated innovation and discovery that can solve the most challenging problems of this century. The Genesis Mission will build an integrated AI platform to harness Federal scientific datasets, the world‚Äôs largest collection of such datasets, developed over decades of Federal investments, to train scientific foundation models and create AI agents to test new hypotheses, automate research workflows, and accelerate scientific breakthroughs. The Genesis Mission will bring together our Nation‚Äôs research and development resources, combining the efforts of brilliant American scientists, including those at our national laboratories, with pioneering American businesses; world-renowned universities; and existing research infrastructure, data repositories, production plants, and national security sites, to achieve dramatic acceleration in AI development and utilization. We will harness for the benefit of our Nation the revolution underway in computing, and build on decades of innovation in semiconductors and high-performance computing. The Genesis Mission will dramatically accelerate scientific discovery, strengthen national security, secure energy dominance, enhance workforce productivity, and multiply the return on taxpayer investment into research and development, thereby furthering America‚Äôs technological dominance and global strategic leadership.
